questions.question_text: Which of the following is a PRIMARY objective of reviewing the effectiveness of a new IT governance system that has been operational for 6 months?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Identifying further governance requirements

Selected Answer: B
B. Identifying further governance requirements

Ans B is correct
Section 8.2.7 Phase 7—How Do We Keep the Momentum Going ?, Page 51, COBIT 2019, Framework Introduction and Methodology
B. Identifying further governance requirements

choices.A: Obtaining executive management support for IT governance

questions.question_text: While value delivery focuses on the creation of value, risk management focuses on which of the following?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B makes sense and is logical

Selected Answer: B
Preservation of Value

Ans B. Preservation of Value
Section 1.2 Risk optimization, Page 12, COBIT 2019 Framework Introduction and Methodology
B. Preservation of value

choices.B: COBIT helps to ensure that a third-party vendor's operations are secure.
choices.A: COBIT provides insight on how to derive value from the use of I&T.
choices.C: COBIT helps to ensure that a governance system is in place to sustain regulatory compliance.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. COBIT provides insight on how to derive value from the use of I&T. By understanding how to maximize the value of information and technology (I&T) within the organization, internal stakeholders can make informed decisions and contribute to overall business success.
C is the best answer

Ans A is correct
Figure 2.1 COBIT Stakeholders, page 15, COBIT 2019 Framework Introduction and Methodology

questions.question_text: Which of the following benefits derived from the use of COBIT is PRIMARILY associated with an internal stakeholder?
To gain the GREATEST benefit from the COBIT framework, a stakeholder should have a certain level of experience and a thorough understanding of:

discussion.content:
Ans B is correct
Section 2.1 Governance Stakeholders, Page 15, COBIT 2019 Framework Introduction and Methodology

choices.C: COBIT helps to ensure compliance with applicable rules and regulations.
choices.A: COBIT provides guidance on how to organize and monitor the performance of I&T across the enterprise.
choices.B: COBIT helps to manage the dependency on the use of external service providers.

questions.question_text: Which of the following benefits derived from the use of COBIT is PRIMARILY associated with an external stakeholder?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
External Stakeholders are Regulators, Business Partners and IT Vendors. [Page #15 of Offcial Guide]

Selected Answer: C
From Figure 2.1—COBIT Stakeholders /// The correct is C

Actually in my opinion, to ensure compliance with external applicable rules and regulations is the Legal and Compliance department's responsibility. Enterprise IT just follow L&C's and the other company's polices. But IT do have relationship with external vendors. I choose B.

Selected Answer: C
The answer is C

Selected Answer: C
Since we have three External Stakeholders in relation to the intended audience:
1. Regulators,
2. Business Partners
3. IT Vendors

Therefore, the benefit that can derived from the use of COBIT in relation to provided options, C becomes the relevant answer.

Selected Answer: C
Ensuring compliance with rules and regulations is often a key concern for external stakeholders, such as regulatory bodies, customers, and business partners. COBIT provides guidance and controls that help organizations meet compliance requirements and demonstrate their commitment to regulatory compliance. While COBIT provides guidance on organizing and monitoring the performance of Information and Technology (I&T) across the enterprise (option A) and helps manage the dependency on external service providers (option B), compliance assurance (option C) is the primary benefit associated with external stakeholders concerned about legal and regulatory obligations.

Selected Answer: B
B. COBIT helps to manage the dependency on the use of external service providers.

This benefit is primarily associated with an external stakeholder, as it relates to the management of external service providers, which are typically third-party entities that provide services to an organization. COBIT provides guidance on how to manage the risks and dependencies associated with using external service providers, such as managing contracts, ensuring service levels are met, and mitigating risks associated with outsourcing or relying on external parties for critical services. This benefit is important for ensuring that an organization's reliance on external service providers is well-managed and aligned with its overall governance and risk management objectives.
C is the correct answer
C. COBIT helps to ensure compliance with applicable rules and regulations.
C. COBIT helps to ensure compliance with applicable rules and regulations.
